`,(0,o.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:"To use Slider Stats, the user must choose what statistic they want to focus on, such as game stats. Then, the user can choose a year and the position they want to analyze. The user then chooses the statistics they want to compare\u2014such as points and minutes per game\u2014and then slides the importance of the selected statistics. Slider Stats allows the user to choose the weight of the different statistics and the range of the statistics, allowing only the players within these ranges to show up in the comparison table. With just these few steps, the user can compare in-depth statistics of their favorite players."},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/vishalshenoy/Desktop/website/content/articles/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-9529480c-d450-4182-bdee-5511254c9f30.mdx",lineNumber:27,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,o.jsxDEV)(n.h3,{id:"features",children:[(0,o.jsxDEV)(n.a,{className:"subheading-anchor","aria-label":"Link to section",href:"#features",children:(0,o.jsxDEV)(n.span,{className:"icon icon-link"},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/vishalshenoy/Desktop/website/content/articles/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-9529480c-d450-4182-bdee-5511254c9f30.mdx"},this)},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/vishalshenoy/Desktop/website/content/articles/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-9529480c-d450-4182-bdee-5511254c9f30.mdx"},this),"Features"]},void 0,!0,{fileName:"/Users/vishalshenoy/Desktop/website/content/articles/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-9529480c-d450-4182-bdee-5511254c9f30.mdx",lineNumber:29,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,o.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:"Delving deeper into the features of this all-in-one website, the importance sliders allow the user to choose the importance of the statistics included in their selection. Additionally, the weighted sum feature is a custom statistic that shows who the best player is given the user\u2019s selection. This feature is particularly useful for NBA analysts as it provides a comprehensive view of a player\u2019s performance, where the highest score is a combination of the selected importance statistics. As for filtering, there is position filtering, where the user can filter players based on their position. The range sliders ensure that the presented data only includes the players who fall within the selected range, which is achieved through a min-max dictionary."},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/vishalshenoy/Desktop/website/content/articles/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-9529480c-d450-4182-bdee-5511254c9f30.mdx",lineNumber:31,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,o.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:"There are two main types of stats in Slider Stats: total statistics and per-game statistics. Total statistics compare players based on accumulated statistics over the season, whereas per-game statistics compare players based on average statistics per game. This website offers many more types of statistics, such as playoffs statistics, clutch statistics, team statistics, and head-to-head statistics."},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/vishalshenoy/Desktop/website/content/articles/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-9529480c-d450-4182-bdee-5511254c9f30.mdx",lineNumber:33,columnNumber:1},this),`

`,(0,o.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:"This groundbreaking NBA statistics analyzer uses NBA API\u2014an API client for NBA.com\u2014which hosts a variety of NBA statistics and is updated daily. The development team utilized the endpoints within the API to gain access to both the raw and advanced statistics, ensuring the utmost accuracy. As for Python libraries, the team used Pandas to convert the data from the API into data frames. They did some data manipulation with these data frames, such as concatenating them together to create a big list of statistics they wanted to use and points per game calculations. To simplify the process of making the front-end using Python, they used Streamlit, allowing them to add widgets such as sliders and buttons onto the website."},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/vishalshenoy/Desktop/website/content/articles/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-9529480c-d450-4182-bdee-5511254c9f30.mdx",lineNumber:37,columnNumber:1},this),`

title: The 41 Finalists Fighting for the Coveted 12 Spots to Represent Team USA at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games
description: By Miwa Hirai and Yaelle Kretchmer

body.raw:
# The 41 Finalists Fighting for the Coveted 12 Spots to Represent Team USA at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games
By: Miwa Hirai and Yaelle Kretchmer January 26, 2024
--- With the 2024 Paris Olympic Games only 6 months away, 41 players are vying for the 12 coveted spots to represent Team USA Men’s Basketball. Steve Kerr—who won three NBA titles as head coach of the Warriors and an additional five as a player—will lead this team as head coach. The team is scheduled to play Canada, South Sudan, and Germany in mid-July as practice for their first preliminary round in the following weeks. _*A key to the abbreviations used in this article can be found at the end of the article._ The chosen 41 are (subject to change): - Bam Abedayo (C, Heat) - Jarrett Allen (C, Cavaliers) - Paolo Banchero (F, Magic) - Desmond Bane (G, Grizzlies) - Scottie Barnes (F, Raptors) - Devin Booker (G, Suns) - Mikal Bridges (F, Nets) - Jaylen Brown (F, Celtics) - Jalen Brunson (G, Knicks) - Jimmy Butler (F, Heat) - Alex Caruso (G, Bulls) - Stephen Curry (G, Warriors) - Anthony Davis (F, Lakers) - Kevin Durant (F, Suns) - Anthony Edwards (G, Timberwolves) - Joel Embiid (C, 76ers) - De’Aaron Fox (G, Kings) - Paul George (F, Clippers) - Aaron Gordon (F, Nuggets) - Tyrese Haliburton (G, Pacers) - James Harden (G, Clippers) - Josh Hart (F, Knicks) - Tyler Herro (G, Heat) - Jrue Holiday (G, Celtics) - Chet Holmgren (C, Thunder) - Brandon Ingram (F, Pelicans) - Kyrie Irving (G, Mavericks) - Jaren Jackson Jr. (F, Grizzlies) - LeBron James (F, Lakers) - Cam Johnson (F, Nets) - Walker Kessler (C, Jazz) - Kawhi Leonard (F, Clippers) - Damian Lillard (G, Bucks) - Donovan Mitchell (G, Cavaliers) - Chris Paul (G, Warriors) - Bobby Portis (F, Bucks) - Austin Reaves (G, Lakers) - Duncan Robinson (F, Heat) - Jayson Tatum (F, Celtics) - Derrick White (G, Celtics) - Trae Young (G, Hawks) **History of USA Men’s Basketball in the Olympics:** Team USA has received a medal in 19 Olympics, 16 of which were gold medals. They hold the highest win record in the history of the Olympics, with 143 wins and 6 losses, which is about a 96% win percentage. Having won four straight Olympic titles in a row, basketball fans and casual Olympics viewers are expecting the USA Basketball team to get their fifth back-to-back title with their world-class basketball players from the NBA. **Predictions For the Final Roster:** **Lebron James** has competed in the Olympics three times so far in his career, in 2004, 2008, and 2012. As an Olympic veteran and in his 20th season in the NBA, 39 year old LeBron James will likely make his final, yet impactful appearance in the 2024 Olympics. Averaging 24.8 PPG in the 2023-2024 season, he is a reliable forward that can help lead Team USA to another gold medal. **Kevin Durant** is known to be one of the best players in NBA history, and boasts numerous amazing achievements, including but not limited to being a 3x Olympic Games qualifier (in 2012, 2016, and 2020), winning 2 NBA Championships, and being a back-to-back NBA Finals MVP. He is currently ranked second in points scored in the Olympic Games, trailing behind Anthony Davis by only 25 points. He averaged 19.4 PPG in the Olympics overall, and is impressively averaging 29.1 PPG in the 2023-2024 season. He is sure to be an asset to Team USA with his ability to play aggressively and consistently scoring under pressure. Both LeBron James and Kevin Durant have won Olympic gold before, and are likely top picks for this year’s team because of their stellar PPG average and incredible consistency. **Stephen Curry** is deemed by many to be the best 3-point shooter in NBA history. As of 2021, he holds the record for most career 3-pointers, exceeding NBA hall-of-famer Ray Allen. While he has not competed in an Olympic Games yet, he has won 4 NBA Championship titles, led the Warriors to a record-breaking 73-9 (73 wins, 9 losses) season in 2015-2016, which led to his accomplishment of being the first unanimously voted league MVP. He also became the 2022 NBA Finals MVP, and scored an average of 26.8 PPG respectively for the 2023-2024 season. With his show-stopping ball handling skills and uncanny awareness for the game, he is sure to be one of the top picks for the final 12. The NBA’s reigning MVP, **Joel Embiid**, has been having a fantastic 2023-2024 NBA season, as he has a PPG average of 36.0, which is the highest in the NBA (as seen in Figure 1 below). As a center for the 76ers, he fulfills his position consistently, with an average of 11.4 rebounds per game (Figure 2). Team USA would benefit greatly from having Joel Embiid as one of the centers, as he excels in his position, as seen from his PPG and rebound stats for this season. ***Figure 1:** PPG Stats 23-24 Season (Source: [NBA](https://www.nba.com/stats/players))* ***Figure 2:** Joel Embiid Regular Season Averages (Source: [ESPN](https://www.espn.com/nba/player/stats/_/id/3059318/joel-embiid))* The four-time NBA All-Star **Donovan Mitchell** was one of the finalists for Team USA back in 2020 for the Tokyo Olympics. As a finalist for the Paris Olympics, Donovan Mitchell is determined to make the national team and lead them to victory. For the 2023-2024 season, he is averaging 27.6 PPG, placing 6th in PPG in the league. He is a reliable shooting guard, as he not only consistently scores points in his games, he also has a relatively high number of steals per game as well, where he currently has the second highest number of steals in the NBA, with an average of 1.9 steals per game (Figure 3). ***Figure 3:** Donovan Mitchell Regular Season Averages (Source: [ESPN](https://www.espn.com/nba/player/stats/_/id/3908809/donovan-mitchell))* ***Key of abbreviations:** - NBA: National Basketball Association - C: Center - F: Forward - G: Guard - PPG: Points Per Game - MVP: Most Valuable Player
Sites used: https://www.nbclosangeles.com/paris-2024-summer-olympics/usa-basketball-reveals-41-finalists-for-2024-olympic-roster/3319817/ https://www.nba.com/news/usa-basketball-mens-national-team-player-pool-2024 https://www.nbcolympics.com/news/basketball-2024-paris-olympic-games-0 https://www.sportingnews.com/us/nba/news/usa-basketball-roster-2024-olympics-paris-players-pool/813dcecd26a66c4762bb1497 https://www.espn.com/nba/player/gamelog/_/id/1966/lebronjames https://www.usab.com/teams/5x5-mens-olympics https://www.sportskeeda.com/basketball/usa-basketball-olympic-records https://www.espn.com/nba/player/gamelog/_/id/3908809/donovan-mitchell https://www.nba.com/stats/players https://www.espn.com/nba/player/stats/_/id/3059318/joel-embiid https://www.nba.com/news/top-moments-durant-back-to-back-finals-mvps

`,(0,t.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:"Team USA has received a medal in 19 Olympics, 16 of which were gold medals. `,(0,t.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:[(0,t.jsxDEV)(n.strong,{children:"Lebron James"},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/vishalshenoy/Desktop/website/content/articles/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-7f5787b9-7c28-4919-aa2b-750db1167dc6.mdx",lineNumber:71,columnNumber:1},this)," has competed in the Olympics three times so far in his career, in 2004, 2008, and 2012. `,(0,t.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:[(0,t.jsxDEV)(n.strong,{children:"Kevin Durant"},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/vishalshenoy/Desktop/website/content/articles/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-7f5787b9-7c28-4919-aa2b-750db1167dc6.mdx",lineNumber:73,columnNumber:1},this)," is known to be one of the best players in NBA history, and boasts numerous amazing achievements, including but not limited to being a 3x Olympic Games qualifier (in 2012, 2016, and 2020), winning 2 NBA Championships, and being a back-to-back NBA Finals MVP. He is currently ranked second in points scored in the Olympic Games, trailing behind Anthony Davis by only 25 points. He averaged 19.4 PPG in the Olympics overall, and is impressively averaging 29.1 PPG in the 2023-2024 season. He is sure to be an asset to Team USA with his ability to play aggressively and consistently scoring under pressure."]},void 0,!0,{fileName:"/Users/vishalshenoy/Desktop/website/content/articles/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-7f5787b9-7c28-4919-aa2b-750db1167dc6.mdx",lineNumber:73,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,t.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:"Both LeBron James and Kevin Durant have won Olympic gold before, and are likely top picks for this year\u2019s team because of their stellar PPG average and incredible consistency."},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/vishalshenoy/Desktop/website/content/articles/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-7f5787b9-7c28-4919-aa2b-750db1167dc6.mdx",lineNumber:75,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,t.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:[(0,t.jsxDEV)(n.strong,{children:"Stephen Curry"},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/vishalshenoy/Desktop/website/content/articles/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-7f5787b9-7c28-4919-aa2b-750db1167dc6.mdx",lineNumber:77,columnNumber:1},this)," is deemed by many to be the best 3-point shooter in NBA history. As of 2021, he holds the record for most career 3-pointers, exceeding NBA hall-of-famer Ray Allen. While he has not competed in an Olympic Games yet, he has won 4 NBA Championship titles, led the Warriors to a record-breaking 73-9 (73 wins, 9 losses) season in 2015-2016, which led to his accomplishment of being the first unanimously voted league MVP. He also became the 2022 NBA Finals MVP, and scored an average of 26.8 PPG respectively for the 2023-2024 season. With his show-stopping ball handling skills and uncanny awareness for the game, he is sure to be one of the top picks for the final 12."]},void 0,!0,{fileName:"/Users/vishalshenoy/Desktop/website/content/articles/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-7f5787b9-7c28-4919-aa2b-750db1167dc6.mdx",lineNumber:77,columnNumber:1},this),`

title: The Soaring Popularity of the Super Bowl

body.raw:
# The Soaring Popularity of the Super Bowl
By: Matthew Chan January 26, 2024
--- The Super Bowl, the pinnacle of the American football season, has become a cultural phenomenon, capturing viewers well beyond sports fans. One noticeable trend in recent years has been a significant rise in viewership, making the event into a highly acclaimed spectacle that crosses conventional boundaries. A look at the historical pattern of Super Bowl viewing will help you understand the recent spike. Since its inception, the Super Bowl has steadily developed from a sporting event to a cultural spectacle, attracting not just ardent football fans but also a varied global audience. The Super Bowl's reach has grown significantly as a result of media globalization and the introduction of streaming technologies. With technological developments, audiences throughout the world can now watch the game, advertisements, and halftime show with unprecedented ease. This expanded accessibility has greatly increased the event's global fan base. The Super Bowl halftime performance has turned into a spectacle in its own right, drawing people who are not die-hard football fans. The addition of top-tier musical acts such as Bruno Mars, Beyonce, Micheal Jackson and other thrilling performances by recognized performers has become a big draw, luring a larger audience demographic. Aside from its sports significance, the Super Bowl has become an important aspect of American society. According to Quora.com, around 100 million people in the United States watch the Super Bowl each year. The 100 million individuals account for around one-third of the US population, or about 33% of US households.The game is a focal point for social gatherings, parties, and shared viewing experiences. As the Super Bowl enters different parts of society, its cultural significance continues to draw people who were previously unfamiliar with the sport. To go even further outside of America, the globalization of the NFL has significantly expanded the Super Bowl's international audience. With games being broadcasted in numerous countries and time zones, the event attracts viewers from diverse cultures who may not have previously engaged with American football. The league's efforts to promote the sport globally, including international games and outreach programs, have contributed to building a broader and more diverse fan base. Super Bowl advertisements have become famous in their own right, eliciting as much excitement as the game itself. Although formal confirmation of ad pricing for Super Bowl LIV is not yet available, Kantar.com estimated total ad spending from in-game commercials at $435 million for the 2019 Super Bowl. Advertisers use the large viewership to display imaginative, memorable ads that appeal to a wide range of consumers. The attractiveness of these advertisements adds to the overall appeal of the Super Bowl, luring people who might otherwise skip a typical athletic event. The development of social media has turned the Super Bowl into a shared event. Viewers interact in real-time chats, post responses, and participate in online forums, fostering a feeling of community even among viewers from many locales. Social media platforms have become strong amplifiers, adding to the enthusiasm around the event. The integration of social media has turned the Super Bowl into a social phenomenon. Viewers engage in real-time conversations on platforms like Twitter, Facebook, and Instagram, sharing reactions, memes, and highlights. Social media not only amplifies the excitement surrounding the game but also facilitates a sense of community as fans from around the world connect through shared experiences. The increase in Super Bowl viewing reflects the event's evolution from a sports championship to a cultural phenomenon with worldwide reach. A combination of variables, including increased accessibility, fascinating halftime entertainment, cultural importance, inventive marketing, and social media involvement, has catapulted the Super Bowl to unprecedented heights of popularity. As the event continues to captivate audiences globally, its continuing popularity implies that the Super Bowl is more than simply a game; it is a common experience that brings disparate groups together to celebrate.

`,(0,d.jsxDEV)(a.p,{children:"The Super Bowl, the pinnacle of the American football season, has become a cultural phenomenon, capturing viewers well beyond sports fans. One noticeable trend in recent years has been a significant rise in viewership, making the event into a highly acclaimed spectacle that crosses conventional boundaries. A look at the historical pattern of Super Bowl viewing will help you understand the recent spike. Since its inception, the Super Bowl has steadily developed from a sporting event to a cultural spectacle, attracting not just ardent football fans but also a varied global audience."},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/vishalshenoy/Desktop/website/content/articles/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-596beeef-625b-4e44-8b06-e7a64f305534.mdx",lineNumber:17,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,d.jsxDEV)(a.p,{children:"The Super Bowl's reach has grown significantly as a result of media globalization and the introduction of streaming technologies. With technological developments, audiences throughout the world can now watch the game, advertisements, and halftime show with unprecedented ease. This expanded accessibility has greatly increased the event's global fan base. The Super Bowl halftime performance has turned into a spectacle in its own right, drawing people who are not die-hard football fans. The addition of top-tier musical acts such as Bruno Mars, Beyonce, Micheal Jackson and other thrilling performances by recognized performers has become a big draw, luring a larger audience demographic."},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/vishalshenoy/Desktop/website/content/articles/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-596beeef-625b-4e44-8b06-e7a64f305534.mdx",lineNumber:19,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,d.jsxDEV)(a.p,{children:"Aside from its sports significance, the Super Bowl has become an important aspect of American society. According to Quora.com, around 100 million people in the United States watch the Super Bowl each year. The 100 million individuals account for around one-third of the US population, or about 33% of US households.The game is a focal point for social gatherings, parties, and shared viewing experiences. As the Super Bowl enters different parts of society, its cultural significance continues to draw people who were previously unfamiliar with the sport."},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/vishalshenoy/Desktop/website/content/articles/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-596beeef-625b-4e44-8b06-e7a64f305534.mdx",lineNumber:21,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,d.jsxDEV)(a.p,{children:"To go even further outside of America, the globalization of the NFL has significantly expanded the Super Bowl's international audience. With games being broadcasted in numerous countries and time zones, the event attracts viewers from diverse cultures who may not have previously engaged with American football. The league's efforts to promote the sport globally, including international games and outreach programs, have contributed to building a broader and more diverse fan base."},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/vishalshenoy/Desktop/website/content/articles/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-596beeef-625b-4e44-8b06-e7a64f305534.mdx",lineNumber:23,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,d.jsxDEV)(a.p,{children:"Super Bowl advertisements have become famous in their own right, eliciting as much excitement as the game itself. Although formal confirmation of ad pricing for Super Bowl LIV is not yet available, Kantar.com estimated total ad spending from in-game commercials at $435 million for the 2019 Super Bowl. Advertisers use the large viewership to display imaginative, memorable ads that appeal to a wide range of consumers. The attractiveness of these advertisements adds to the overall appeal of the Super Bowl, luring people who might otherwise skip a typical athletic event."},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/vishalshenoy/Desktop/website/content/articles/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-596beeef-625b-4e44-8b06-e7a64f305534.mdx",lineNumber:25,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,d.jsxDEV)(a.p,{children:"The development of social media has turned the Super Bowl into a shared event. Viewers interact in real-time chats, post responses, and participate in online forums, fostering a feeling of community even among viewers from many locales. Social media platforms have become strong amplifiers, adding to the enthusiasm around the event. The integration of social media has turned the Super Bowl into a social phenomenon. Viewers engage in real-time conversations on platforms like Twitter, Facebook, and Instagram, sharing reactions, memes, and highlights. Social media not only amplifies the excitement surrounding the game but also facilitates a sense of community as fans from around the world connect through shared experiences."},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/vishalshenoy/Desktop/website/content/articles/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-596beeef-625b-4e44-8b06-e7a64f305534.mdx",lineNumber:27,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,d.jsxDEV)(a.p,{children:"The increase in Super Bowl viewing reflects the event's evolution from a sports championship to a cultural phenomenon with worldwide reach.
